channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 50 years later, a journalist reunites with 'Santa Claus' Jewish newspaper boy
item.description: In 1967, a journalist wrote about a boy buying presents on Christmas Eve. The story got an overwhelming response from readers. Fifty years later, the young boy and the journalist reconnected.
item.content:encoded: In 1967, a journalist wrote about a boy buying presents on Christmas Eve. The story got an overwhelming response from readers. Fifty years later, the young boy and the journalist reconnected.
item.dc:creator: Robin Washington

item.title: These salamanders supercool themselves to handle the snow
item.description: Blue spotted salamanders can supercool themselves so they can walk over ice and snow during their spring migrations
item.content:encoded: Blue spotted salamanders can supercool themselves so they can walk over ice and snow during their spring migrations
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: An American doctor describes volunteering in Gaza
item.description: An American doctor journals her daily life as a volunteer in al-Shifa hospital, which was once Gaza's largest medical facility.
item.content:encoded: An American doctor journals her daily life as a volunteer in al-Shifa hospital, which was once Gaza's largest medical facility.
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: Zelenskyy says he's open to pull back troops if Russia does too
item.description: Ukraine's president says he open to pulling troops back from parts of the east if Russia also pulls back its forces.
item.content:encoded: Ukraine's president says he open to pulling troops back from parts of the east if Russia also pulls back its forces.
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: How the clergy has rallied against the Trump administration's immigration policies
item.description: Religious leaders have rallied against the Trump administration's detention and deportation of immigrants. Clergy are filing lawsuits, accompanying migrants to court hearings and leading protests.
item.content:encoded: Religious leaders have rallied against the Trump administration's detention and deportation of immigrants. Clergy are filing lawsuits, accompanying migrants to court hearings and leading protests.
item.dc:creator: Jack Jenkins

item.title: NPR listeners share their untraditional holiday traditions
item.description: Holiday traditions don't all come with matching sweaters and cookie recipes — some are stranger, funnier, and deeply personal. We asked our listeners to share their unconventional holiday traditions.
item.content:encoded: Holiday traditions don't all come with matching sweaters and cookie recipes — some are stranger, funnier, and deeply personal. We asked our listeners to share their unconventional holiday traditions.
item.dc:creator: Matt Ozug

item.title: 2025 has seen an explosion of AI-generated slop
item.description: 2025 has seen an explosion in AI-generated slop. NPR's Geoff Brumfiel and Shannon Bond discuss how AI-generated videos are shaping reality online.
item.content:encoded: 2025 has seen an explosion in AI-generated slop. NPR's Geoff Brumfiel and Shannon Bond discuss how AI-generated videos are shaping reality online.
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Her Christmas lights were going up. Then Border Patrol showed up
item.description: A North Carolina woman left her front yard Christmas tree half-decorated after immigration agents questioned men helping her. The unfinished tree stands as a symbol of the immigration crackdown.
item.content:encoded: A North Carolina woman left her front yard Christmas tree half-decorated after immigration agents questioned men helping her. The unfinished tree stands as a symbol of the immigration crackdown.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Florido

item.title: ADHD drugs work indirectly to improve attention
item.description: New research suggests that prescription stimulants for ADHD don't actually improve attention directly. They work on different pathways in the brain that support attention. .
item.content:encoded: New research suggests that prescription stimulants for ADHD don't actually improve attention directly. They work on different pathways in the brain that support attention. .
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: A man is making gingerbread houses to extreme proportions and lengths
item.description: Peter Williams makes highly elaborate gingerbread houses. He's depicted San Francisco's Painted Ladies and zoo, as well as a replica of the International Space Station.
item.content:encoded: Peter Williams makes highly elaborate gingerbread houses. He's depicted San Francisco's Painted Ladies and zoo, as well as a replica of the International Space Station.
item.dc:creator: Jordan-Marie Smith
